items.text: flat length ball angling in towards off and middle, keeps his front pad away from the line and defends into the covers
items.postText: Maiden to Shakib. He's only conceded five in his four overs.
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, no run

items.text: shortish, angling across to off stump. Jumps to ride the bounce and work it to the right of midwicket
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: A wide slip - fourth slip, approximately - in place for Holder
items.text: back of a length, angling away from off stump. Holder pokes and misses, not really moving his feet
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, no run

items.text: fuller now, on off stump, and Holder drives sweetly, with high left elbow, to the right of the sweeper at deep point. Excellent timing, and he forces Sabbir Rahman into a sprawling dive
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, 2 runs

items.text: length ball on off stump, defended into the covers
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs to third man
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Holder, 1 run

items.text: full, angling away into a fifth-stump line, chases at it with a flat-bat drive, misses
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.preText: Nitish: "In the last two years (from today) only thrice has Mustafizur taken more than 2 wickets in an ODI innings. The last of those was vs Windies at Dhaka in early December 2018. We have seen an improved performance today but his injuries and form have regularly given Bangladesh something to worry about in the last two years. Hope he regains consistency before the WC starts. " -- He's looking very good today, accurate with a bit of movement away from the right-handers and into the left-handers.
items.text: flighted ball drifting in towards middle stump, clipped away through square leg
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on middle and leg, whipped to deep square leg
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, 1 run

items.text: flat length ball straightening towards off stump, defended into the covers
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, no run

items.text: lovely change of pace, similar trajectory and line to the previous one, but slower and it dips shorter. Pushes at it in defence and only manages an inside edge into the leg side
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, no run

items.text: length ball on the stumps, looks to push into the leg side, can't really time it
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, no run

items.text: down the track to the flighted ball on off and middle, clipped down to long-on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run

items.preText: Change in bowling. Soumya Sarkar to bowl his gentle medium.
items.text: length ball on off stump, goes on the back foot to work it down the ground to long-on
items.shortText: Soumya Sarkar to Holder, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on off stump, lets it come on and dabs with soft hands to the left of backward point. Brings up his fifty with that shot
items.shortText: Soumya Sarkar to Hope, 1 run

items.text: fullish close to off stump, looks to push to long-off, plays slightly early and pops it in the air briefly. Shakib moves quickly from extra-cover to field it, and there's a bit of hesitation in running the single. Had Shakib's throw hit at the bowler's end, Holder would have been gone
items.shortText: Soumya Sarkar to Holder, 1 run

items.text: fullish on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
items.shortText: Soumya Sarkar to Hope, no run

items.text: shortish on off stump, worked away through square leg
items.shortText: Soumya Sarkar to Hope, 1 run

items.text: short, wide, a bit of gentle outswing. Goes too hard at the slash and misses
items.shortText: Soumya Sarkar to Holder, no run

items.preText: Seth: "@Hasib Zubayer No offence, but I totally disagree. He may not have pace of swing, but he still picks up crucial wickets. And him being on the field captaining has completely changed Bangladesh in the pasts few years. Not sure how, but he get's people to do their best. Maybe the players realize this is really something to play for if their captain is 35 has had numerous surgeries and just keeps on playing his hardest. To me it is obvious play Mashrafe as long as he is fit and is willing to play."
items.text: back of a length, sliding down leg. Looks to work it off the back foot and misses, and it hits him on the left pad
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: fuller now, on the stumps, clipped through square leg
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on off stump, punched into the covers
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, no run

items.text: down the track, makes a bit of room, can't force this wide-ish length ball past extra-cover
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, no run

items.text: flat length ball on off stump, looks to go back and work it to long-on but straight midwicket cuts off the angle
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, eased to deep point off the back foot
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Holder, 1 run
